intro: Bilabrella dalzielii, commonly known as the Dalziel's bilabrella, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its inflorescence consists of clusters of showy, tubular flowers. Bilabrella dalzielii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant colors and unique floral structure.
